{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1861 of the Social Security Act

header.#text: Remote patient management services for chronic health conditions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Such term shall not include a telecommunication that consists solely of a telephone audio conversation, facsimile, or electronic text mail between a health care professional and patient.

term.#tail: means the remote monitoring, evaluation, and management of an individual with a covered chronic health condition (as defined in paragraph (2)), insofar as such monitoring, evaluation, and management is with respect to such condition, through the utilization of a system of technology that allows a remote interface to collect and transmit clinical data between the individual and the responsible physician (as defined in subsection (r)) or practitioner or other supplier (as defined in subsection (d)) for the purposes of clinical review. Such services shall include in-home technology based professional consultations, patient monitoring, patient training services, clinical observation, assessment, treatment, and any other services that utilize technologies specified by the

text.#text: The term
For purposes of paragraph (1), the term
congestive heart failure;
chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; and
in the case of services furnished at a federally qualified health center, diabetes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with appropriate physician, practitioner, and supplier groups, shall develop guidelines on the frequency of billing for remote patient management services. Such guidelines shall be determined based on medical necessity and shall be sufficient to ensure appropriate and timely monitoring of individuals being furnished such services.

text.#text: The
The

Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this subsection, develop, in consultation with appropriate physician, practitioner, and supplier groups, standards (governing such matters as qualifications of personnel and the maintenance of equipment) for remote patient management services for the covered chronic health conditions specified in paragraph (2).
Periodically review and update such standards under this subparagraph as necessary.

by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with appropriate physician groups, practitioner groups, and supplier groups, shall take into consideration—

text.#text: In determining relative value units for remote patient management services (as defined in
physician or practitioner resources, including physician or practitioner time and the level of intensity of services provided, based on—
the frequency of evaluation necessary to manage the individual being furnished the services;
the complexity of the evaluation, including the information that must be obtained, reviewed, and analyzed; and
the number of possible diagnoses and the number of management options that must be considered;

practice expense costs associated with such services, including the direct costs associated with installation and information transmission, costs of remote patient management technology (including equipment and software), device delivery costs, and resource costs necessary for patient monitoring and follow-up (but not including costs of any related item or non-physician service otherwise reimbursed under this title); and
malpractice expense resources.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for separate payment for such services and shall not adjust the relative value units assigned to other services that might otherwise have been determined to include such separately paid remote patient management services.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1834(m)(2) of the Social Security Act

header.#text: Payment methods for other patient sites

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may develop and implement payment methods that would apply under this subsection in the case of an individual who would be an eligible telehealth individual except that the telehealth services are furnished at a site other than an originating site. Such methods shall be designed to take into account the costs related to the site involved and reduced costs for the distant site.
